CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 16, 1952, pg. 20, reads: "Everybody's Singing 'Cry'...It Tops Hit-Tune List! Churchill Kohlman, right, Pittsburgh night watchman and author of the latest top tune, 'Cry' with Johnnie Ray, singer, who helped skyrocket the song. - Teenie Harris Photo."Cutline of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1952, pg. 23 reads: " 'Prince of Wails' Opens at Stanley...America's newest singing sensation, Johnnie Ray, comes to Pittsburgh this Friday, June 20, to head his own stage show at the air-conditioned Stanley Theatre, downtown...Ray will be singing Pittsburgh composer Churchill Kohlman's "Cry" as well as many of his recorded hits during his Stanley stage appearance..."
TitMainTitle: Johnnie Ray and Churchill Kohlman holding sheet music for their song "Cry," with another man seated on right
